summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney to an investigator regarding phone records in the Epstein case. The email requests checks on specific phone numbers mentioned in FBI 302 reports and message pads, and asks for a background 'workup' on an individual identified by the last name 'esterday' (likely a typo for 'yesterday').

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, requesting follow-up on phone records and background checks related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document is an email from an AUSA dated April 25, 2019, concerning investigative follow-up on phone records.
It references FBI 302 reports indicating specific phone numbers were subpoenaed.
It mentions phone messages found on 'message pads from West Palm' from at least two individuals, whose numbers need to be identified.
The AUSA requests a background 'workup' on an individual referred to by the last name 'esterday' (likely a typo).
The email indicates ongoing investigative efforts to identify contacts and obtain records related to phone communications.
